description: Triangle T(n,k) = number of degree-n permutations with k even cycles, k=0..n.
references: I. P. Goulden and D. M. Jackson, Combinatorial Enumeration, Wiley, N.Y., 1983, p. 189, Exercise 3.3.13.
links: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
maple: with(combinat):b:= proc(n, i) option remember; expand(`if`(n=0, 1, `if`(i<1, 0,      add(multinomial(n, n-i*j, i$j)*(i-1)!^j/j!*b(n-i*j, i-1)*      `if`(irem(i, 2)=0, x^j, 1), j=0..n/i))))    end:T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, i), i=0..n))(b(n$2)):seq(T(n), n=0..12);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Mar 09 2015
